intro: Eurya chinensis subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow-flowered eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its bright floral display. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
